text: hi
my name is jeannie ding
i'm a product manager of the aws
database migration service
the aws cloud provides very flexible
solutions to enable and enhance your
data leak strategies
in this series of videos my colleagues
suvendo and i will show you how to use
aws database migration service to move
your data from relational databases to
an amazon s3 data link
let's get started
so what's happened over the last number
of years as customers have accumulated
so much data
a lot of that data lives in different
styles
and it's really hard to do analytics
when you have to go to all of those
different data cycles
customers are looking for a highly
scalable available secure and flexible
data store or a data lake
that can handle extremely large data
sets
[Music]
with the data lake
customers can store all their structured
and unstructured data
using an open data format of their
choice
like orc or parquet
and tag their data in a central
searchable catalog
customers can run any type of analytics
they want
from historical reporting to machine
learning based predictive analytics
efficiently without having to transform
or move large amounts of data
and by far the most popular data lake
infrastructure today is s3
so why s3 as a core component for data
leak storage
before you start your data lake setup
you want to think about storing all your
data in a centralized place and ensure
to build a data layer that is scalable
secure and highly available
if you're looking to amazon s3 it offers
11 lines of durability
it is highly secure and best in class
compliance
it offers audit capabilities and
provides object level controls
it is massively parallel and scalable
it has cost effective storage classes
and it has a broad ecosystem and
supports various service integrations
all of these features are precisely why
you should be choosing amazon s3 as the
foundation of your data lake storage
currently one of the most effective way
to move your data from data silos to
data lakes is aws database migration
service
[Music]
aws database migration service or dms
helps you to move data quickly and
securely
you can use dms to continuously
replicate data with low latency from any
supported source to any supported target
this of course includes replicating from
multiple sources to amazon s3 to build a
highly available and scalable data lake
solution
dms is simple to use
it is a service fully managed by aws
and you can start your replication with
just a few clicks on the aws management
console
it is cost effective and you only pay
for the computing resources used in the
replication process and additional log
storages
it is also flexible to support a wide
range of databases and provide a rich
set of features
including validation and pre-migration
assessment to customize your replication
tasks
with dms you can replicate data from any
of the supported relational nosql and
analytics sources
such as aurora postgresql and mysql
continuously to amazon s3
and more sources will be added in the
future
this will simplify your solution if your
data resides in multiple database
engines
as dms is the only tool you'll need to
move the data into your data lake
with the help of dms setting up and
synchronizing data lakes is easy fast
and secure
in the next video we will discuss in
detail on how to configure your dms
tasks and the best practices specific to
building data links
thank you very much for watching
we'll see you in the next video
